name: Berge knot
summary: A Berge knot is a specific class of knots in the 3-sphere (\(S^{3}\)) that are related to lens space surgeries. A key characteristic is that when a non-trivial Dehn surgery is performed along the knot, the resulting manifold is a lens space. They are also known as doubly primitive knots because they can be described as a simple closed curve on a genus 2 Heegaard surface that is primitive in each of the two handlebodies.Â
